questions.text: Early in the film, Tony Montana (Al Pacino) is interrogated by law enforcement officers the moment he arrives in the USA.  He tells these men a number of things.  Which of the things he says to these men turns out to be TRUE?
questions.correct: He served in the army in Cuba.
options: He has never been to jail.
All of these statements are true.
questions.explanation:
He served in the army in Cuba.

	We learn later in the film that Tony HAS been in jail, and that his mother is still alive.  His claim about having served in the army, though, seems to be legitimate -- that's where he and Manolo learned how to use machine guns, if nothing else.

questions.text: While working as a dishwasher, Tony and his best friend Manolo (Steven Bauer) are offered a job by Omar Suarez (F. Murray Abraham).  How much does Suarez offer to pay Tony and Manny for buying some cocaine from Colombian associates?
questions.explanation:
$5,000.

	Tony and Manny are offered five grand for making the buy.

questions.text: In perhaps the most controversial scene in the film, Tony's friend Angel (Pepe Serna) is brutally murdered before his eyes by a man wielding a chainsaw. Tony exacts the perfect revenge by killing this man with the same chainsaw.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Tony does kill the man a few minutes after Angel is murdered, but Tony uses his gun, not the chainsaw.

questions.text: To drown out the noise of Angel's murder, one of the Colombians turns up the television in the hotel room.  What movie is playing as Angel is being killed?
options: Journey to the Center of the Earth
questions.explanation:
Earthquake.

	The famous 1974 disaster movie is clearly recognizable to anyone who's seen it...and it is an awfully loud film!

questions.text: Elvira Hancock (Michelle Pfeiffer) tells Tony that she hates his car.  Finish her description of it: "It looks like someone's ______________."
questions.explanation:
nightmare.

	Tony immediately buys a Porsche instead.

questions.text: When Tony sees his sister Gina (Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio) for the first time in many years, he presents her with a gift.  What does he give her?
questions.explanation:
a necklace.

	A large heart hangs from the ornate necklace.

questions.text: Several times in the film, cocaine is referred to not as "blow" or "white," but rather by a Spanish nickname.  What term do Omar Suarez and Mel Bernstein (Harris Yulin) use to refer to cocaine?
questions.explanation:
yeyo.

	Anyone out there know the origin of this term?  All I can find from a brief internet search is that "yeyo" is, and I quote, "a Spanish term for cocaine."

questions.text: Just before Tony is almost killed at the Babylon Club, a noted stand-up comic plays the part of the club's emcee, who introduces an unusual entertainer.  Who is this stand-up comic?
questions.explanation:
Richard Belzer.

	Belzer would later achieve unlikely fame on the TV show "Homicide" and endless permutations of "Law and Order".

questions.text: Just before Tony asks Elvira to marry him, she pours him a drink from the poolside mini-bar.  What's the drink?
questions.explanation:
scotch.

	He says "I like scotch". Elvira seems to pour the same drink for herself, as well.

questions.text: Quite a few murders take place in this film.  Which of the following is NOT true?
questions.explanation:
Manny kills Omar Suarez.

	Suarez is actually killed by a minion of Alejandro Sosa, Frank's (and later Tony's) major connection in Bolivia. Hope you enjoyed the quiz.  The world is yours!
